info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 31 at 3:29PM EDT until March 31 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 400 PM EDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN RANDOLPH...WEST CENTRAL POCAHONTAS AND SOUTHERN WEBSTER COUNTIES... At 326 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Addison, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and dime size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Webster Springs, Addison (Webster Springs), Camden-On-gauley, Snowshoe, Camden On Gauley, Mingo, Cowen, Monterville, Slaty Fork, Upper Glade, Waneta, Edray, Valley Head and Bergoo. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
